Active Processor Cores: All of cores to enable in each processor package
QPI Bandwidth Priority: Set Intel QPI Randwidth Priority _RTID_ to Compute _ 32_24_32
Intel_ HT Technology: Enabled for thread per enabled core is enabled
Force PXE first: Whenever the BIOS boots up the system_ the first PXE_capable device is inserted as the first device in the boot sequence_  Enabling this feature causes the BIOS operation to occur on the next and all subsequent boots and causes a change in the system_s defined boot sequence _unlike tokens 93h and 94h__  The BIOS chooses the first PXE_capable device as the system_s onboard network controller_ if present and enabled_ or the first bootable network device found in the system_s standard PCI search order _ whichever comes first_
Restore on AC Power Loss: After an AC power loss_ when AC power is restored_ the system will power on_
NIC1 _ KAWELA: Enable the system_s primary embedded network interface controller _full_function__ including its PXE boot_ROM_
Quick Boot: Allows BIOS to skip certain tests while booting_ This will decrease the time needed to boot the system_
Wait For _F1_ If Error: Disabled the BIOS from prompting for F1_F2 on error_ BIOS pauses at F1_F2 prompt
Network Drives_1st Drive: The first NIC is used for PXE boot_ followed by NIC2
Intel_R_ Virtualization Tech: Enable for a VMM to utilize the addition HW Caps_ provided by Intel_R_ Virtualization Tech
NIC2 _ KAWELA: Enable the system_s secondary embedded network interface controller _full_function__ including its PXE boot_ROM_
NUMA Support: Enable NUMA is efficiently execute software for NUMA aware OS
Quiet Boot: Disabled the display of the splash or summary screen_ The user is able to see the detail of the POST messages
